The Rise of Women's Football Around the Globe

By Lere Dakshak Mamman

Women's football is experiencing a renaissance. With increasing viewership, investment, and global support, the sport is breaking barriers and inspiring a new generation of athletes and fans... The Nigerian national football team, the Super Eagles, are in high spirits as they prepare for a decisive FIFA World Cup Qualifier clash against rivals South Africa's Bafana Bafana. The match, scheduled for June 5th at the Abuja National Stadium, is expected to draw a massive crowd as both teams chase a spot at the 2026 World Cup in the USA, Canada, and Mexico. Head Coach Finidi George, who recently took over the reins, announced a provisional 26-man squad this morning. The list includes top names like Victor Osimhen, Wilfred Ndidi, and Samuel Chukwueze, as well as new call-ups from the Nigeria Professional Football League (NPFL). “We are focused, we respect South Africa, but we're ready to fight for our ticket,” said Finidi during a press conference. Meanwhile, the South African camp has also ramped up training with their coach, Hugo Broos, confident his side can silence the Abuja crowd once again, just as they did during the 2023 AFCON semi-finals. Security has been tightened around the stadium, and the Nigerian Football Federation (NFF) has assured fans of a well-organized matchday experience. Tickets are already on sale online and at authorized outlets nationwide. Other Headlines in Nigerian Sports: Enyimba FC clinches a narrow 1-0 win over Rivers United to stay top of the NPFL table. Blessing Okagbare hints at possible comeback for the 2025 African Games. Anthony Joshua confirms next heavyweight bout against Zhilei Zhang set for August in London.
